metadata.title: CVE-2024-26665 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:tunnels: fix out of bounds access when building IPv6 PMTU errorIf the ICMPv6 error is built from a non-linear skb we get the followingsplat,  BUG: KASAN: slab-out-of-bounds in do_csum+0x220/0x240  Read of size 4 at addr ffff88811d402c80 by task netperf/820  CPU: 0 PID: 820 Comm: netperf Not tainted 6.8.0-rc1+ #543  ...   kasan_report+0xd8/0x110   do_csum+0x220/0x240   csum_partial+0xc/0x20   skb_tunnel_check_pmtu+0xeb9/0x3280   vxlan_xmit_one+0x14c2/0x4080   vxlan_xmit+0xf61/0x5c00   dev_hard_start_xmit+0xfb/0x510   __dev_queue_xmit+0x7cd/0x32a0   br_dev_queue_push_xmit+0x39d/0x6a0Use skb_checksum instead of csum_partial who cannot deal with non-linearSKBs.

criterions.comment: linux package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
linux-hwe-5.8: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-hwe-5.11').
